block.p: A Victorian Romance

Feb. 18 -- A staged reading of "The Barretts of Wimpole Street" at 7:30 P.M. at the Manhattan Church of Christ, 48 East 80th Street, will benefit Survivor Productions, a nonprofit theater company specializing in Victorian melodramas. Members of the company will participate in the reading of Rudolph Besier's play about the courtship of Elizabeth Barrett and Robert Browning. A wine reception at 7 precedes the performance. Tickets $15; (212) 877-2988. Cancer Care Award

Feb. 19 -- Cancer Care's eighth annual human services award dinner and dance at the Waldorf-Astoria will honor Richard L. Gelb, chairman and chief executive of the Bristol-Myers Squibb Company. The event will benefit Cancer Care, which offers patients and their families psychosocial services at no charge. Tony Randall will be the toastmaster and Melba Moore will entertain. The party starts at 6:30 P.M. Black tie. Tickets $500 and $1,000; (212) 997-0100. Dinners for Six

Feb. 19 -- Sixty-four New York restaurants will set aside tables for six people for evenings between Feb. 19 and March 19 that corporations and individuals may buy for a contribution of $2,000 to Citymeals-on-Wheels, a private organization which, in cooperation with the New York City Department of the Aging, provides meals for homebound elderly people. The restaurants will provide special menus and wines. The contributions will be given to Citymeals. Contributors who reserve tables will be guests at a Dom Perignon reception at 5:30 P.M., at the TriBeCa Grill, 375 Greenwich Street at Franklin Street. (212) 577-1758. A Party After Moliere

Feb. 20 -- A performance of Moliere's "The Misanthrope" with a party and music after the 8 P.M. performance at the Westbeth Theater, 151 Bank Street, between Washington and West Streets in the West Village, will benefit the Colossal Theater Company. Members of the company, which presents experimental and classic plays, will perform. Tickets $25; (212) 924-0077. Again for Citymeals

Feb. 20 -- Members of the fashion and cosmetics industries are holding a cocktail party and buffet from 6 to 9 P.M. at Remi, 145 West 53d Street, to benefit Citymeals-on-Wheels. Proceeds from their party for Citymeals last year provided 15,000 meals for homebound aged people. Ruth Finley, publisher of the Fashion Calendar and Gerald Shaw, president of Oscar de la Renta, are co-chairmen of this year's event. Tickets $125; (212) 577-1758. A Nautical Evening

Feb. 21 -- Proceeds from a buffet dinner and dance at the American Museum of Natural History will support the museum's 1992 exhibition on global warming. The theme of the party, which starts at 9 P.M. in the Hall of Ocean Life, will be a "Night in the Sea." Black tie or nautical attire. Tickets $120, $140 at door; (212) 769-5151. Music and Comedy

Feb. 21 -- Proceeds from an evening of music and comedy starting at 8 P.M. at Town Hall, 123 West 43d Street, will benefit the New York City Chapter of the National Organization for Women. Linda Cook, an actress in the soap opera "Loving," and Ruth W. Messinger, the President of the Borough of Manhattan, will be among the speakers. Tickets $20, $25 and $30; (212) 840-2824 (212) 947-5850. Overlooking the Harbor

Feb. 22 -- Cancer Care's Junior Committee is holding a cocktail party with dancing and entertainment to benefit the organization at the TriBeCa Ballroom of the Whitehall Club at 17 Battery Place. The party starts at 9 P.M. Black tie. Tickets $75, $85 at door; (212) 221-3300, extension 206. National Urban League

Feb. 22 -- The National Urban League Guild's 49th annual Beaux-Arts Ball at the Waldorf-Astoria starts at 9 P.M., and will be followed by a champagne breakfast at 1 A.M. Guests of honor will be Percy Sutton, the chairman of the Inner City Broadcasting Company; the actresses and singers Carrie Smith and Linda Hopkins; Rosa Guy, the novelist and playwright, and Sir James Randolph, a pop and jazz singer. Tickets $145 for dance and breakfast; $95 for dance only, $100 at door; (212) 310-9000 or (212) 310-9223. George Washington Ball

Feb. 22 -- The Fraunces Tavern Museum at 54 Pearl Street at Broad Street and the scholarship fund of the Daughters of the Cincinnati will be benefit from the 30th annual George Washington Ball at the Plaza, sponsored by the Sons of the Revolution. The Distinguished Patriot Award of the Sons of the Revolution will be given to Clement E. Conger, the curator of the diplomatic reception rooms at the State Department. Black tie. Tickets $250 and $500; (212) 425-1778. Victoria de los Angeles

Feb. 24 -- Proceeds from a recital by the soprano Victoria de los Angeles at 5 P.M. at the Manhattan School of Music, Broadway and 122d Street, will help replenish the school's voice scholarship fund. Tickets $50 for the orchestra and loge; $25 for the balcony; (212) 749-2802, extensions 540 and 541. Workout in Brooklyn

Feb. 24 -- Molly Fox, Jeff Martin, Chuck Gemme, members of the Pollan-Austen Fitness Team and other aerobic and exercise trainers will conduct classes from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. at the Eastern Athletic Club at 43 Clark Street in Brooklyn Heights to benefit the AIDS home-care program of the Visiting Nurse Service of New York. Registration fees, $20 to $95, depend on the number of classes desired. (212) 794-9200. Honoring Role Models

Feb. 25 -- The annual Sidewalks of New York benefit dinner for Big Brothers/Big Sisters of New York City at the Waldorf-Astoria will honor prominent New Yorkers who are regarded as role models for the young. They are Dr. David Baltimore, the president of Rockefeller University; Earle G. Graves, the publisher of Black Enterprise magazine;, Judith Jamison, the artistic director of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater; G. G. Michelson, a senior vice president of R. H. Macy & Company and the chairman of the board of trustees of Columbia University, and Freeman McNeil, a running back for the New York Jets. Cocktails at 6:30 P.M., dinner at 7:30. Tickets $350 and $500; call (212) 580-5511 or (212) 686-2042. Upper East Side Planning

Feb. 25 -- The rezoning projects of Civitas, a watchdog planning group on the Upper East Side, will benefit from a cocktail reception from 6:30 to 9 P.M. at at Christie's, Park Avenue at 59th Street. Tony Hiss, The New Yorker writer and the author of "The Experience of Place," will narrate of slide show of the American landscape. Tickets, $35, at door or call (212) 996-0745.
